etymologies: late 15th century: from French, from late Latin indultum ‘grant, concession’, neuter past participle of Latin indulgere ‘indulge’

definitions: (in the Roman Catholic Church) a license granted by the Pope authorizing an act that the common law of the Church does not sanction.
shortDefinitions: (in Roman Catholic Church) licence granted by Pope authorizing act that common law of Church does not sanction
